pullRequest.title: Consolidates GH action build to a single file
pullRequest.bodyText:
This consolidates the two build processes into one flow, containing all
previous functionality, but less build time.
This builds the server on ubuntu, os/x and windows. If ubuntu, the flow
will continue into building and testing all our Docker images.
Something new is that this skips out if the change is documentation-only.

nodes.bodyText:
Not sure, but are you able to use a single-element item in the matrix as a variable?
matrix:
  ubuntu-os:
  - ubuntu-20.04

...

if: matrix.os == ${{ matrix.ubuntu-os }}
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,19 +1,33 @@
-name: Continuous Build Server
+name: Continuous Build
+
+# Trigger on pushes or pull requests to the master branch, but not for documentation-only updates.
 on:
   push:
     branches:
       - master
+    paths-ignore:
+      - '**/*.md'
   pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master
+    paths-ignore:
+      - '**/*.md'
+
+# DEFAULT_OS is ubuntu-20.04 (focal) as that's the same as we use in Travis. This is find/replaced

commit.message:
Consolidates GH action build to a single file

This consolidates the two build processes into one flow, containing all
previous functionality, but less build time.

This builds the server on ubuntu, os/x and windows. If ubuntu, the flow
will continue into building and testing all our Docker images.

Something new is that this skips out if the change is documentation-only.

Something new is that this skips out if the change is documentation-only.
